source_page.note: Discrepancy between page number in transcription header and footer.

Qualifiers.scope: Applies to the planning and construction of below-grade patios, also referred to as 'such features', 'excavated features', 'lightwells & stairwells'.

exclusions.subject: Area Calculation
exclusions.details: The area devoted to required stairway egress is not included in the 200 sf single area limitation.

exclusions.subject: Measurement Basis
exclusions.details: Measurements are based on the interior dimension of the opening and exclude the enclosing structure.

Variables.name: location_relative_to_front_yard
Variables.description: The location of the below-grade feature relative to the side of the structure that faces the front yard.

Variables.name: combined_area
Variables.description: The sum of the areas of all below-grade features on the lot.

Variables.name: single_area
Variables.description: The area of any single below-grade feature.

Variables.name: lot_area
Variables.description: The total area of the lot.

Variables.name: separation_distance
Variables.description: The distance separating one below-grade feature from another.

Variables.name: side_yard_encroachment
Variables.description: The distance a feature encroaches into a required side yard.

Variables.name: rear_yard_encroachment
Variables.description: The distance a feature encroaches into a required rear yard.

Variables.name: combined_encroachment_length
Variables.description: The combined length of all portions of features that encroach into any required yards.

Variables.name: tree_impact
Variables.description: The effect of excavation on neighboring trees. (Qualitative)

Variables.name: architectural_compatibility
Variables.description: The design compatibility of the feature with the main residence. (Qualitative)

Variables.name: screening_method
Variables.description: The method used for screening, such as landscaping or fencing.

Constants.name: combined_area_limit
Constants.logic: The greater of 2% of lot area or 200 sf

Constants.name: measurement_standard
Constants.procedure: Measurements are based on the interior dimension of the opening, excluding the enclosing structure.

flags.context: Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring trees.
Such areas to be architecturally compatible with residence.
Boxed note: 'No single below-grade patio may [not] exceed 200 sf'
flags.issue: Word 'not' is unclear in photocopy. Assumed to mean 'may not exceed' based on other text.

Conditions.description: Features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard.
No single area may exceed 200 sf.
Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater.

Conditions.if: More than one below-grade feature exists

then.description: Each such area must be separated from another by at least 10'.

Conditions.description: Allowable encroachment into a required side yard is 2' max.
Allowable encroachment into a required rear yard is 4' max.
The combined length of all encroaching portions of features may not exceed 15'.
Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring trees.
Public Works Department must approve the drainage system.
Areas must be architecturally compatible with the residence.
Areas must be screened from off-site views by landscaping and/or fencing, as determined appropriate by the Planning Dept.

Exceptions.description: The area calculation for the 200 sf limitation on a single area does not need to include the area devoted to required stairway egress.

Relationships.hierarchical: This regulation is a comprehensive set of standards for a single feature type ('below-grade patios'), encompassing rules for location, dimension, separation, encroachment, environmental impact, and design.

cross_references.description: Overhangs or canopies installed to shelter a below-grade patio area shall count towards the 'lot coverage' calculation, linking this feature to a separate regulation.
Encroachment rules are dependent on the definition of 'required side yard' and 'required rear yard', which are established by setback regulations.

logical_dependencies.dependency: The 10' separation rule is only triggered if more than one below-grade feature is proposed.
The combined encroachment length is the sum of individual encroachment lengths (e.g., 'a + b' from the diagram).
Final approval of the drainage system is contingent on the Public Works Department.
The choice and adequacy of the screening method is contingent on the Planning Department.
